title: In Harry Potter and The Sorcerer's Stone, what did Harry mean when he asked 'Sorry, what's curious? ' to Ollivander? - Quora

response.answer_text: When Harry appeared to be so compatible with the Holly/Pheonix feather wand, Ollivander said " Curious....very Curious". Harry of course, didn't know the wands strange story. He didn't know much about anything of the wizarding world at that point. He must have been expecting Ollivander to be happy about finding a suitable wand. So it was natural that he wanted to know what was curious about a perfectly nice wand.

Harry Potter asks "Sorry, but, what's curious?" because Olivander expresses his shock that the wand that chooses Harry, happens to be the brother (or twin) of the wand that chose Tom Riddle almost 50 years earlier, by saying "Curious. Very curious!" Harry merely wants to know what Olivander thinks is so curious.
